screen_desc: The screenshot shows the search screen of the Facebook Messenger app. The user appears to be searching for "facebook messenger" in the search bar at the top. There is a back arrow on the left and a close icon on the right. The main content area is blank, indicating that no results have been returned yet. The bottom of the screen shows the typical navigation bar.
history_actions: click on the Google Play Store app located at the bottom.
click on the search icon (a magnifying glass) located at the top-right corner of the screen.

think.Thought: The user wants to uninstall 'Fetch Rewards,' but currently, they are in the Google Play Store search screen with 'facebook messenger' typed in the search bar. To proceed with the uninstallation, I need to correct the search query to 'Fetch Rewards' so the app can be located in the Play Store.
Future Action Plan: Clear the current search query by clicking the close (X) icon.
Type 'Fetch Rewards' in the search bar.
Search for 'Fetch Rewards' and locate the app in the results.
Click on the 'Fetch Rewards' app from the search results.
Click the 'Uninstall' button to remove the app.
